sentences.english: O holy Jesus, Prince of peace and Saviour.
sentences.chinese: 聖哉耶穌，萬民救主和平王。

sentences.english: Our goal is to lead people to know Jesus and "make disciples of all nations".
sentences.chinese: 本會的目標是領人歸主及使萬民作主的門徒。

sentences.english: The Lord frustrates the plans of the nations and brings to nothing the peoples' designs.
sentences.chinese: 上主使異邦的計劃無緒，使萬民的策略廢去。

sentences.english: I will praise you, O Lord , among the nations; I will sing of you among the peoples.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華阿，我要在萬民中稱謝你，在列邦中歌頌你。

sentences.english: An earnest prayer for your country and other countries is well becoming in the mouth of every believer.
sentences.chinese: 信徒要爲萬國萬民常常迫切代禱，本是聖經的教導。

sentences.english: Refine fine goods for people is the company' s persevering pursue.
sentences.chinese: 精製良品爲萬民是公司孜孜不倦的追求。

sentences.english: Then all the peoples on earth will see that you are called by the name of the LORD, and they will fear you.
sentences.chinese: 天下萬民見你歸在耶和華的名下，就要懼怕你。

sentences.english: And I took my staff, even Beauty, and cut it asunder, that I might break my covenant which I had made with all the people.
sentences.chinese: 我折斷那稱爲榮美的杖，表明我廢棄與萬民所立的約。

sentences.english: The heavens declare his righteousness, and all the people see his glory.
sentences.chinese: 諸天表明他的公義，萬民看見他的榮耀。

sentences.english: Why do the nations conspire and the peoples plot in vain?
sentences.chinese: 外邦爲什麼爭鬧，萬民爲什麼謀算虛妄的事。

sentences.english: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?
sentences.chinese: 外邦爲什麼爭鬧，萬民爲什麼謀算虛妄的事。

sentences.english: The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.
sentences.chinese: 樹上的葉子乃爲醫治萬民。

sentences.english: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.
sentences.chinese: 他必以公義審判世界，按正直判斷萬民。

sentences.english: He will judge the world in righteousness and the peoples in his truth.
sentences.chinese: 他要按公義審判世界，按他的信實審判萬民。

sentences.english: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.
sentences.chinese: 你使我們在萬民中成爲污穢和渣滓。

sentences.english: You have made us a byword among the nations; the peoples shake their heads at us.
sentences.chinese: 你使我們在列國中成爲話柄，在萬民中使人搖頭。

definition: ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)
the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
to revere as sole orthodoxy/to hold supremacy (of a religion, ideology, cultural norm, social group etc)/to be dominant
favorable weather (idiom); good weather for crops
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
righteousness/virtuous cause/a woman's marriage/main points of a piece of writing
